intro: Conioselinum kamtschaticum var. alpinum, commonly known as the alpine tarragon, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Europe and Western Siberia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. It features slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a subtle anise-like aroma, making it a valued plant in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
